PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Agfa Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, February 28, 1942, pg. 17, reads: "Pittsburgher Drills For Franklin Fight - Two action shots of Harry Bobo as he goes about his training chores in preparation for his bout with Lem Franklin at the Pittsburgh Gardens on Monday, March 30. One section shows the Peabody giant had at work punching the bag, while the other pictures show him in action against one of his sparring mates. - Harris Photo."Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, May 9, 1942, pg. 17, reads: "Harry Bobo, young Pittsburgh heavyweight, who fights Gus Dorazio in Philadelphia Monday night, may be the fighter to succeed Joe Louis as heavyweight champion of the world.  A good boxer, a knockout artist, Bobo is 21 years of age and the best young prospect on the fistic horizon.  If he gets by Dorazio he is slated to fight Lou Nova or Bob Pastor in June. - Courier Photo."
TitMainTitle: Heavyweight boxer Harry Bobo, shadowboxing in ring, in gymnasium
